Issues.Title: GetLineFromCharIndex return an error result
Issues.Body:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/GetLineFromCharIndex-return-an-error-res/10314554)._

---
[severity:I'm unable to use this version]
Pasting a hyperlink into a rich text box will cause the characters after the hyperlink to return an error result when using GetLineFromCharIndex

Issues.Title: Question/Documentation In VB Project Properties under Package I can set Release Notes but no way to retrieve
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

N/A

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

N/A

### Issue description

I can't find any way to retrieve Release Notes <PackageReleaseNotes> at runtime. I can get Title, Version, Description and the rest of the information.

### Steps to reproduce

Add the following lines to .vbprog file, you can use Visual Studio
```
<PackageReleaseNotes>Requires Windows 10 or later and .Net 7.0 of later
</PackageReleaseNotes>
```
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12789369/226584159-757b4e27-25ed-4d5a-bbf6-bbd82b712bc4.png)

The description says I can use in UI but I don't see it available at runtime.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Question/Documentation In VB Project Properties under Package I can set Release Notes but no way to retrieve" (#8880)

Issues.Title: Add Span overloads for Graphics text methods
Issues.Body:
Adds `ReadOnlySpan<char>` overloads to `Graphics.DrawString`, `MeasureCharacterRanges`, and `MeasureString`.

Cleaned up docs for these methods as well and called span/string overloads in existing tests.

Fixes: #8844

cc: @ericstj, @ViktorHofer, @carlossanlop

Issues.Title: Issue involving GetPropertyItem / PropertyItems and Nikon cameras
Issues.Body:
When I attempt to retrieve EXIF tags for either the Artists/Authors (tag 0x013B) or Copyright tag 0x8298) from Nikon cameras, both GetPropertyItem and ProperyItems methods for System.Drawing.Image object fails to retrieve the information.  

I've tried it with both .NET 4.8 and .NET 7.0 with the same results.

GetPropertyItem will throw a "System.ArgumentException", while PropertyItems will just return the other EXIF tags.

I've encountered this issue with photographs taken using Nikon's D850, D5, D6 and Z9 cameras.  I have not encountered this issue with photographs taken with various Canon cameras.

FYI, Windows Explore property displays the information when you examine Properties on the photographs.  Also, I am able to retrieve the information by using Shell32.dll calls.

And FWIW, when you load and then save a photograph from a Nikon camera using either Photoshop or MS Paint, then the GetPropertyItem and PropertyItems methods will work properly.  Both of those apps must correct whatever the precise issue is when they save the image.

I've placed a sample Nikon photograph at https://app.box.com/s/wwltqsks3r24i8ugxb4ztmyh97hd22wn for testing purposes.

Here's a sample GetPropertyItem call that I've simplified down to the bare essentials:

```
   Const EXIF_ArtistName As UInt16 = &H13B

    Dim img As Bitmap
    Dim prop As System.Drawing.Imaging.PropertyItem
    Dim value As String

    img = New Bitmap(fileName)
    prop = img.GetPropertyItem(EXIF_ArtistName)  ' this statement will trigger an exception with a photograph from a Nikon camera
    value = System.Text.Encoding.UTF7.GetString(prop.Value, 0, prop.Len - 1)  ' remove trailing 00H character

```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Issue involving GetPropertyItem / PropertyItems and Nikon cameras" (#8872)

Issues.Title: Derived form is write protected
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Visual Studio 2022 - Community Edition, Version 17.5.2

### .NET version

.Net 7.0

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

Yes: With Visual Studio 2019 and .Net Framework 4.6.2

### Issue description

A derived form cannot be edited with VS 2022:

See attached project:

- BaseForm.cs: is the base form class
- BaseMDIChild.cs: inherits from BaseForm.cs
- BaseMDIERPDataChild.cs: inherits from BaseMDIChild.cs

This form seems to be write protected. You cannot insert any control.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open the project, compile it
2. Open the form BaseMDIERPDataChild.cs and try inserting a control

### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Derived form is write protected" (#8882)

Issues.Title: Dispose Cursor only if it is owned by the creator.
Issues.Body:
While investigating flaky tests, found that Cursor Handle is being set to null even if the cursor is not owned by the specific scope. This has been the case since .NET framework. Disposing handle only if owned by creator. 

Some static Cursors in WinForms are incorrectly categorized as `owned`. Making any change around `owned` flag on these could break existing applications. In this change, we are recreating static cursors if their handle is disposed.

Related #8810 

fixes #8373 

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/8865)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Dispose Cursor only if it is owned by the creator." (#8865)

Issues.Title: Windows Automation RaiseAutomationPropertyChangedEvent throws System.AccessViolationException
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

6.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

### Issue description

Windows Automation RaiseAutomationPropertyChangedEvent method for SelectionPatternIdentifiers.SelectionProperty throws System.AccessViolationException.
No exception is thrown if the AutomationPropertyChangedEvent for SelectionPatternIdentifiers.SelectionProperty values are "null" or "new IRawElementProviderSimple[0]".

### Steps to reproduce

1. Run attached app:
[UiaAccessViolationException6.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/11000223/UiaAccessViolationException6.zip)
2. Run "Accessibility Insights For Windows" or similar application
3. Start listening to all events
4. Press button "button1"
5. Observe thrown System.AccessViolationException
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Windows Automation RaiseAutomationPropertyChangedEvent throws System.AccessViolationException" (#8867)

Issues.Title: Documentation should not redirect to .NET 4.8 documentation if it doesn't apply to .Net 3+ Winforms.
Issues.Body:
### Environment

learn.microsoft.com

Microsoft Visual Studio Enterprise 2022
Version 17.5.0
VisualStudio.17.Release/17.5.0+33414.496
Microsoft .NET Framework
Version 4.8.09032



### .NET version

.NET 6+

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

Yes, the docs are correct for .NET 4.8

### Issue description

Users evaluating .NET 6/7 will search the internet and find documentation on learn.microsoft.com (but for .NET 4.8)
They use the combobox to select .NET 6/7 and are redirected back to the 4.8 documentation.
When it is wrong, they assume nothing has changed and the documentation is relevant for them.
They don't go to the Github repro and check the wiki/docs there that are more correct.
They get confused and call Microsoft.

example, customer wondering why his controls wouldn't show up in the Winform's designer toolbox even though he was following the documentation.
here are a few links in that area.
learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/desktop/winforms/controls/how-to-display-a-control-in-the-choose-toolbox-items-dialog-box?view=netframeworkdesktop-4.8&viewFallbackFrom=netdesktop-6.0

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/desktop/winforms/controls/walkthrough-automatically-populating-the-toolbox-with-custom-components?view=netframeworkdesktop-4.8&viewFallbackFrom=netdesktop-6.0

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/desktop/winforms/controls/how-to-display-a-control-in-the-choose-toolbox-items-dialog-box?view=netframeworkdesktop-4.8&viewFallbackFrom=netdesktop-6.0

### Steps to reproduce

1.  navigate to learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/desktop/winforms/controls/how-to-display-a-control-in-the-choose-toolbox-items-dialog-box?view=netframeworkdesktop-4.8
2. Change the combobox from .NET Famework 4.8 to .NET 7

Expected Results
===========
No documentation

Actual Results
==========
Still looking at the 4.8 docs even though things don't work that way anymore, but thinking they still apply.
We need correct documentation.

### Diagnostics

```text
NA
There is a banner at the top that states...
"The requested page is not available for .NET 6.0. You have been redirected to the newest product version this page is available for."
However, every customer and support engineer I have talked to miss it.  I think it looks too much like an Ad, and we've been trained to ignore content that doesn't look like it's part of the article, but that is just a guess.
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Documentation should not redirect to .NET 4.8 documentation if it doesn't apply to .Net 3+ Winforms." (#8866)

Issues.Title: Run unit tests sequentially.
Issues.Body:
Replacing #8772.

changes:
- Serialize execution of unit tests on build agents.
- Block tests against `hsplit.cur` and `vsplit.cur`. They need special attention with respect to disposing them. Possibly a bug that has been there since Framework.
- Remove collection definition that is not necessary anymore.
- Add retry count (1).

Tracking issue to regroup unit tests as well as fixing UI tests are tracked by #8810.

Fixes #6610 Fixes #4212 fixes #6729 fixes #8632 fixes #8602 fixes #8609 fixes #8601 fixes #8611 fixes #3647

Issues.Title: WebBrowser control blocks accelerators of buttons on form
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 6.0, .NET 7.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

.NET 4.8

### Issue description

See attached sample: I have a "System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser" control on a UserControl.
The UserControl and the root form contain buttons with accelerator keys. In .NET6, the accelerators for the buttons don't work reliable.


### Steps to reproduce

Focus the textbox on the UserControl, then press "Alt" and one of the accelerator keys "B" or "O". 

- The button on the user control will be clicked when pressing the accelerator the second time. On first button press, nothing happens.
- The "OK" button on the root form is never called.

The sample also has target framework 4.8 to demonstrate that this it worked there.

[WebBrowserTest.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/10990996/WebBrowserTest.zip)

The event "WebBrowserControl.PreviewKeyDown" is called twice for each button. This means I cannot handle a "Alt + accelerator" press myself (and search for a button with this accelerator).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WebBrowser control blocks accelerators of buttons on form" (#8862)

Issues.Title: Fix DragDropTests
Issues.Body:
* Make sure to start a drag/drop operation on DragEnter (DragOver may or may not occur due to test speed)
* Match Mouse Down with Mouse Up
* Remove artificial delays

⚠️ **DO NOT MERGE**: The updated tests are being forced to run 100 times each to demonstrate stability in CI
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix DragDropTests" (#8860)
